alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Southern Brevard; Inland St. Lucie; Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hurricane Local Statement issued June 04 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: This product covers East Central Florida **ALL TROPICAL STORM WARNINGS AND FLOOD WATCHES HAVE BEEN CANCELLED** NEW INFORMATION --------------- * CHANGES TO WATCHES AND WARNINGS: - All watches and warnings have been canceled * CURRENT WATCHES AND WARNINGS: - None * STORM INFORMATION: - About 40 miles northeast of Fort Pierce FL - 27.8N 79.8W - Storm Intensity 45 mph - Movement Northeast or 50 degrees at 18 mph SITUATION OVERVIEW ------------------ Potential Tropical Cyclone One, now centered just offshore of the Treasure Coast, will continue moving northeast and away from east- central Florida this afternoon and evening. As a result, the Tropical Storm Warnings for Brevard, Indian River, Saint Lucie, and Martin Counties have now been cancelled. The Flood Watch for the Treasure Coast has also been cancelled. Gusty squalls, with winds up to 35 mph, remain possible along the coast through the evening. Tropical storm force gusts are still possible over the Atlantic waters of the Space and Treasure Coasts through this evening. Winds and seas will begin to improve overnight tonight as the broad center of Potential Tropical Cyclone continues moves well east of the local waters. POTENTIAL IMPACTS ----------------- * FLOODING RAIN: Little to no impacts are anticipated at this time across East Central Florida. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS ---------------------------------- Be alert for flooded roads which could be compromised or littered with debris. Do not drive through places where flood waters cover the road. Turn around, don`t drown! * ADDITIONAL SOURCES OF INFORMATION: - For information on appropriate preparations see ready.gov - For information on creating an emergency plan see getagameplan.org - For additional disaster preparedness information see redcross.org NEXT UPDATE ----------- As it pertains to this event...this will be the last local statement issued by the National Weather Service in Melbourne FL regarding the effects of tropical cyclone hazards upon the area.
